English: Heh, that punch stung, I'll give you that.
Chinese: 你的拳頭還挺有力的嘛。
Korean: 댁의 펀치, 꽤 먹혔어
German:
He, das hat wehgetan, das muss ich dir
lassen.

English:
That was a really childish thing of you to do back
there, but...that's not necessarily a bad thing,
either.
Chinese:
雖然我覺得你只是個小鬼，
但這樣也不壞呢……
Korean:
스스로도 어린애 같다고는 생각하지만
그런 것도 나쁘지 않아…
German:
Was du da getan hast, war echt kindisch, aber
vielleicht auch nicht ganz schlecht.

English: Hey, [p]?
German: He, [p]?

English: Uh...
Korean: 아
German: Äh ...

English: Tha'...
Korean: 고…
German: Da ...

English: Th-thanks...
Chinese: 謝……謝……你
Korean: 고… 마… 워
German: D-Danke ...

English:
You plan on staring at me all quiet like that all
day or something?
Cut it out, [p]!
Chinese: ……你啊，差不多該改掉不吭一聲地盯著人看的習慣了。
Korean:
…댁 말이야, 아무말 없이 쳐다보는 버릇
슬슬 그만둬
German:
Willst du mich den ganzen Tag lang stumm
anstarren? Hör auf damit, [p]!

English:
It's weird and embarrassing seeing that! I mean...
I guess that's kind of your thing, but still!
Chinese:
會讓人很害羞啊！
……雖然，這樣才像你。
Korean:
부끄럽잖아!
…뭐, 그게 댁 답다고는 생각하지만
German:
Es ist komisch und peinlich! Ich meine ...
Das ist halt dein Ding, aber trotzdem!

English:
Actually, to be honest...I have something I need
to ask you.
Chinese: 其實，我有事想請你幫忙。
Korean:
…실은 말이야
댁에게 긴히 부탁하고 싶은 게 있어
German: Um ehrlich zu sein, muss ich dich um etwas bitten.

English:
Because of all that trouble I ran into, I'm
starting to feel like I'm falling behind the rest
of you in terms of sheer strength and whatnot.
Chinese:
怎麼說，因為很多原因，
我現在有點“落伍＂……
Korean:
뭔~가 여러 가지로 옥신각신댄 탓에
난 지금 "한참 뒤쳐진" 상태야
German:
Wegen all der Probleme, die ich hatte, habe ich
das Gefühl, dass ich mit euch anderen in Sachen
Stärke und so nicht mithalten kann.

English:
I hate just leaving all the cool stuff to you and
Nokia, so...
Chinese: 都讓你和諾奇雅出風頭也讓人覺得不太爽……
Korean:
댁이나 노키아한테만
멋진 멋진 모습 보이게 하는 것도 아니꼽고 말이지…
German:
Ich hasse es, Nokia und dir die ganzen coolen
Sachen zu überlassen, und ...

English:
I want you to come with me for a little while.
I'll file this as a proper case, so now you have
to do it as part of your job, right?
Chinese:
稍微陪我一下，
我會重新提出委託的。
這件事就這麼決定囉，大偵探。
Korean:
잠깐 나랑 어울려줘
다시 의뢰는 해 둘게…
규칙이니까 말이야, 탐정님
German:
Ich möchte, dass du mich eine Weile begleitest.
Ich mache das zu einem richtigen Fall, dann
ist es Teil deines Jobs, nicht wahr?

English:
I have something I need you to do for me. I can
count on you to handle it, right? I'll make sure
to file the paperwork at your workplace.
Chinese:
我有事想拜託你，你當然願意幫我吧？
我會提出委託的。
Korean:
댁한테 부탁하고 싶은 게 있어
물론 받아줄 거지? 의뢰, 해둘게
German:
Du musst da etwas für mich erledigen. Ich kann
doch auf dich zählen, oder? Ich werde auch alles
in deinem Büro anmelden.

English:
So you'll come along with me after all? Great!
Thanks a lot, [p].
I mean it.
Chinese:
你接受我的委託了啊。
嘿嘿，謝啦。
Korean:
의뢰 받아줬구나
헤헷, 고마워
German:
Du kommst also doch mit? Klasse!
Vielen Dank, [p].
Das meine ich wirklich.

English:
There's only one thing I have in mind for us to
do and that's go out and capture me a really
strong Digimon.
Chinese:
委託內容不為別的就是——
我想去抓強大的數碼寶貝。
Korean:
의뢰라는 건 다름이 아니라
조금 강력한 디지몬을 캡처하러 가고 싶어
German:
Ich habe nur eins geplant. Ich will, dass wir
losgehen und mir ein echt starkes Digimon
fangen.

English:
All the crap I've had to put up with lately has
meant I'm short on new Digimon and that's not
good, not in the least.
Chinese:
因為很多原因，我不像你有新的數碼寶貝。
以現在所有的戰力來說，還是略嫌不足。
Korean:
옥신각신댄 탓에 댁들처럼 새로운 디지몬도 없는 데다
지금의 전력으론 역시 조금 부족하거든
German:
Wegen all meiner Probleme in letzter Zeit, habe
ich keine neuen Digimon. Das ist nicht gut.
Ganz und gar nicht.

English:
Besides...I also have some revenge that I need to
exact sooner rather than later.
Chinese:
還有！
我也想順便“復仇＂。
Korean:
………플러스!
가는 김에 "리벤지"도 하고 싶어
German:
Außerdem ... will ich mich für etwas rächen, und
zwar so bald wie möglich.

English:
Let's get going, [p].
We're going to Under Zero.
Chinese:
[p]
陪我去一趟「Under Zero」。
Korean:
[p]
「언더 제로」에 같이 가 줘
German:
Auf geht’s, [p].
Wir gehen zu Unter Null.

English:
I'm sure you remember, but to get to Under Zero,
we have to go through the Valhalla Server. This
won't be easy, but I trust you to get us through.
Chinese:
要去Under Zero就要先進到「瓦爾哈拉伺服器」……
這可能會有點困難，那就拜託你囉。
Korean:
언더 제로에 가려면 우선「발할라 서버」지…
조금 하드한 느낌이 되긴 하겠지만 잘 부탁해
German:
Du weißt es sicher noch, aber um zu Unter Null zu
gelangen, müssen wir zum Walhalla-Server. Das wird
nicht leicht, aber du schaffst das schon.

English:
I...can count on you, right,
[p]?
Chinese: 可以吧？　[p]
Korean: …의지해도 되지? [p]
German:
Ich ... kann doch auf dich zählen, oder,
[p]?

English:
Well, regardless, any Digimon and Eaters we meet
up ahead will be stronger than anything else
you've met before, so be careful.
Chinese:
之後，不管是侵食者還是襲向我們的數碼寶貝，
應該會變得比之前更強。
Korean:
앞으로는 이터도, 습격해오는 디지몬도
이전보다 더욱 강해질 거야
German:
Die Digimon und Verschlinger, die wir sehen
werden, sind stärker als alle, die du bisher
gesehen hast. Sei also vorsichtig.

English:
When I went with some Jude guys to take on Under
Zero, we had been unstoppable in EDEN up until
then.
Chinese:
……過去我和Jude的伙伴去挑戰Under Zero時，
在EDEN我們從沒輸過。
Korean:
…쥬드의 동료들과 언더 제로에 도전했던 그때
우리는 EDEN에선 누구보다도 강했어
German:
Als ich mit ein paar Jungs von Gamma bei Unter
Null war, waren wir bis dahin in EDEN unschlagbar.

English:
Nobody could beat us. Adults, cops, nobody. We
figured Under Zero would be the same way, even
with its reputation for being impregnable.
Chinese:
大人和警察都不是我們的對手，
我們以為難攻不下的Under Zero也會是我們的手下敗將。
Korean:
어른이든 경찰이든 상대가 되지 않았지
난공불락인 언더 제로도 무너뜨릴 수 있을 거라 생각했어
German:
Niemand konnte uns besiegen. Erwachsene,
Polizisten, niemand. Trotz des Rufs dachten wir,
dass es mit Unter Null genauso sein würde.

English:
But we hit a snag when we got to the outer wall...
A security Digimon showed up and kicked our asses.
It was a complete and utter wash.
Chinese:
但是……在防禦牆後的「防衛數碼寶貝」突然出現……
我們輸了……完全慘敗。
Korean:
하지만… 방벽 너머에 있던「보안 디지몬」…
갑자기 나타난 그 녀석에게 우리는 져버렸어… 완패였지
German:
Aber als wir die äußere Wall erreichten, tauchte
ein Wach-Digimon auf und hat uns übel mitgespielt.
Es war ein totaler Reinfall.

English:
Back then, we didn't know anything about
Digimon programs at all.
Chinese: 那時候我們不知道數碼寶貝程式這種東西……
Korean: 그 때 우리는 디지몬 프로그램 같은 건 몰랐어서 말이야…
German:
Zu dem Zeitpunkt wussten wir nichts über
Digimon-Programme.

English:
We were only capable of doing analog hacking,
which made us completely powerless to fight back.
Chinese: 只有類比駭客技能的我們完全束手無策……
Korean:
아날로그 해킹 스킬밖에 없었던 우리는
문자 그대로 꼼짝없이 당했어
German:
Wir konnten nur analog hacken, was hieß, dass wir
nicht zurückschlagen konnten.

English:
All we could do was grab our asses and run.
Some of my buddies, they went crazy from the fear
they felt there.
Chinese:
我們夾著尾巴逃了……
有幾名伙伴因為當時的恐懼而變得不太正常。
Korean:
꼬리를 말고 도망쳤지…
동료들 중 몇 명은 그 때의 공포로 이상해져 버렸어
German:
Es blieb uns nichts übrig, als wegzulaufen.
Einige meiner Freunde wurden dort irre vor Angst.

English:
Even the guys that were okay, they saw what they
were up against and lost confidence in themselves.
Chinese:
平安無事的人也因壓倒性的力量差距而
喪失自信……
Korean:
무사했던 녀석들도 압도적인 힘의 차이를 뼈저리게 느껴
자신감을 잃었고…
German:
Und selbst der Rest, dem es besser erging,
hat bei diesem Anblick den Mut verloren.

English:
The whole thing made it vividly clear to us that
we were little more than a pack of arrogant brats
running wild.
Chinese: 總之，我們太過自滿了。
Korean: 요컨대 우리는 너무 자만했었던 거야…
German:
Das Ganze hat uns klargemacht, dass wir nur
ein paar wild gewordene, arrogante Kinder waren.

English:
We let our pride get to us to the point where we
bit off more than we could chew. The higher you
rise, the farther you fall and all that.
Chinese: 自尊越高，遇到挫折時的衝擊就越大。
Korean:
쌓아올려온 프라이드가 높았던 만큼
좌절했을 때의 충격은 컸어
German:
Unser Stolz verführte uns dazu, uns zu
überschätzen. Hochmut kommt vor dem Fall und so.

English:
And one by one, people quit being hackers...
It was the end of the legendary hacker group Jude.
Chinese:
伙伴們一個接一個放棄當駭客——
最後傳說的駭客集團Jude解散了。
Korean:
한둘씩 해커를 은퇴해서―
이윽고 전설의 해커 집단 쥬드는 해산됐지
German:
Und einer nach dem anderen gaben die Leute
das Hackerdasein auf ... Das war das Ende der
legendären Gamma-Gruppe.

English:
I felt sorry for myself and hated to see it go.
It sucked being powerless to stop them from
leaving the team.
Chinese: 沒有辦法挽留伙伴的自己實在很丟臉　……真不甘心。
Korean:
떠나가는 동료들을 막지 못하는 자신이
한심하고, …분했어
German:
Ich suhlte mich im Selbstmitleid und war wütend,
dass es zu Ende war. Es war schlimm, dass ich sie
nicht davon abhalten konnte, das Team aufzugeben.

English:
I also had a constant fear in me I couldn't shake.
Just remembering that time was enough to make me
tremble with trauma...
Chinese:
我自己心理的恐懼也無法消失……
當時只要回想起來，腳就不停地顫抖。
Korean:
나 자신도 사라지지 않는 공포를 안고 있었던 거야…
당시의 일은 떠올리는 것만으로 다리가 떨려와
German:
Ich hatte permanent Angstzustände. Schon die
Erinnerung daran lässt mich erzittern.

English:
I didn't want anyone seeing me like that, though.
So I tried to buck up and make it seem I was fine.
Chinese:
因為不想被任何人看見那副慘樣，
所以我一個人逞強，裝作毫不在意。
Korean:
…그런 꼴을 아무에게도 보이고 싶지 않아서
혼자 고집부리고 태연한 척 하고 있었어
German:
Ich wollte aber nicht, dass mich jemand so sieht.
Also versuchte ich, mich zusammenzureißen,
und tat so, als ob nichts wäre.

English: ...So that's why I see this as revenge.
Chinese: ……所以，這次要復仇。
Korean: …그러니까, 이건 리벤지야
German: ... Deshalb rede ich von Rache.

English:
I'll make that security Digimon's power my own
and finally rid myself of this regret...
Chinese:
我要讓那隻防衛數碼寶貝的力量變為自己所有，
洗清汙名……
Korean:
그 보안 디지몬의 힘을 내 것으로 만들어
분한 마음을 풀겠어…
German:
Ich werde mir die Macht des Wach-Digimons aneignen
und diese Reuegedanken endlich
hinter mir lassen ...

English: I'm not the punk ass kid I once was back then.
Chinese: 我已經不是那時候的我了。
Korean: 나는 이제 그 때의 내가 아니야
German: Ich bin nicht mehr der kleine Junge von damals.

English:
I'm better than that, better than my past...
Now come on, let's go.
Chinese:
我要超越過去……
好了，走吧。
Korean:
나는 과거를 극복할 거야…
…자, 가자
German:
Ich bin besser, besser als meine Vergangenheit ...
Los, gehen wir jetzt.

English:
Hahaha! So you're still standing guard here.
Color me happy. It's nice to see you again!
Chinese:
……嘿嘿嘿，你還是在這裡呢。
真令人開心。
Korean:
…헤헤헤, 여전히 여기에 있구만
기쁘네
German:
Hahaha! Du stehst hier ja immer noch Wache.
Das freut mich aber. Schön, dich
wiederzusehen!

English: Hey, you remember who I am?
Chinese: 你還記得我嗎？
Korean: 나를 기억하고 있어?
German: Weißt du noch, wer ich bin?

English: I don't. Who are you...?
Chinese: 你是誰啊……
Korean: 누구냐, 너는
German: Nein. Wer bist du ...?

English: Don't tell me you've forgotten now.
Chinese: 可別說你忘了我喔？
Korean: 기억나지 않는다고는 하지 않겠지?
German: Tu nicht so, als ob du es vergessen hättest.

English:
It seems that I have... At the very least, you're
not in my memory banks.
Chinese:
……我忘了。
應該說，我沒有記錄你的資料。
Korean:
…기억나지 않는군
그렇다기보다 네 데이터는 기억되어 있지 않다
German:
Doch, das habe ich wohl ... Zumindest bist du
nicht in meinen Speicherbanken.

English:
Hahaha! I knew it! I mean it makes sense, why
would you!? You beat us so fast!
Chinese:
哈哈哈！　我想也是！
畢竟我一瞬間就被你打敗了。
Korean:
하하핫! 그렇겠지!
워낙 한순간에 당했으니까
German:
Hahaha! Ich wusste es! Das ergibt schon Sinn.
Warum solltest du das auch tun? Du hast
uns so schnell besiegt!

English: But I remember... Hell, I could never forget you.
Chinese: 但是，我還記得……怎麼可能忘得了！
Korean: …하지만, 나는 기억하고 있어… 잊을 수 있을 리가 없지!
German:
Aber ich erinnere mich ... Ich könnte dich nie
vergessen.

English:
I don't understand what it is you're speaking of,
but any intrusion will not be tolerated.
Chinese:
我完全無法理解你在說什麼。
……如果你想再往前的話，我就只能驅逐你了。
Korean:
네가 무슨 말을 하는 건지 이해 불가능이다
…이 앞으로 갈 생각이라면 배제할 뿐
German:
Ich verstehe nicht, wovon du redest, aber es
wird kein Eindringen geduldet.

English:
Ah, yes. Of course. This is just how it went the
first time, too!
Chinese:
啊啊……是啊！
不錯嘛，跟那時候一樣的台詞！
Korean:
아아… 아아!
좋네, 그 때랑 똑같은 대사잖아!
German:
Ach ja. Natürlich. So war es beim letzten Mal
auch!

English:
Seriously, this is great! Wouldn't have it any
other way. You're perfect just the way you are!
Chinese:
真是謝天謝地！
一點都沒變！
Korean:
고맙다!
아무런 변함 없이 있어줘서 말이야!
German:
Das ist wirklich toll! Ich würde es mir nicht
anders wünschen. Du bist perfekt, so wie du bist!

English:
Unlike you, though, I'm a changed man. My legs
don't shake and my mind's cleared up now! I've
grown up!
Chinese:
我跟以前可不一樣！
腳沒有顫抖，眼睛正看著你，頭腦也很清醒！
Korean:
…나는 옛날과는 달라!
다리도 떨리지 않고, 눈도 제대로 보이고, 머리도 맑아!
German:
Im Gegensatz zu dir habe ich mich aber verändert.
Meine Beine zittern nicht und ich bin bei klarem
Verstand. Ich bin erwachsen geworden!

English:
I'm here to get vengeance for my friends! I'll
kick your ass and march right on through!
Chinese:
來吧，讓我替伙伴報仇！
我要打倒你向前進！
Korean:
자, 동료들의 빚을 갚아주겠어!
나는 너를 쓰러뜨리고 앞으로 나아갈 거야!
German:
Ich bin hier, um mich für meine Freunde zu rächen!
Ich werde dich vermöbeln und hineinmarschieren!

English:
I won't lose this time! Not with my friend
[p] at my side here!
Chinese: 這次我會打倒你！　——和伙伴一起！
Korean: 이번엔 쓰러뜨리겠어! ――동료와 함께 말이야!
German:
Dieses Mal werde ich nicht verlieren! Nicht mit
[p] an meiner Seite!

English: You know what? I feel...at peace now.
Chinese: ……我放心了。
Korean: …안심했어
German:
Weißt du was? Ich fühle mich mit mir und der Welt
im Reinen.

English:
I've probably been a burden to you guys with the
Digimon I've kept with me up until now.
Chinese:
要是我之前的數碼寶貝，
一定會扯你們的後腿。
Korean:
지금까지의 내 디지몬으론
분명 댁들의 발목을 잡았을 거야
German:
Wahrscheinlich war ich euch eine Last, wegen der
Digimon, die ich bis jetzt bei mir hatte.

English:
But now that I've got this guy...I think I can go
on with you all. I want to see this thing through
to the end.
Chinese:
但是得到這傢伙的話，在這之後……也能和你們一起走下去。
反正都走到這裡了，我想看到最後啊。
Korean:
…하지만 이 녀석이 있으면 이 앞으로도… 댁들과 함께 갈 수 있어
이왕이면 마지막까지 지켜보고 싶으니까 말이야
German:
Aber da ich dieses jetzt habe, werde ich das schon
schaffen. Ich will es zu Ende bringen.

English: ...Haha, don't make me say it. Seriously.
Chinese: ……真是，不要讓我說這種話啦。
Korean: ………헤헤, 말하게 하지 말라고
German:
... Haha, zwing mich nicht, es zu sagen. Ich meine
es ernst.

English:
...
Dammit, didn't I tell you before?
Quit with the staring already! Jeez!
Chinese:
……
……我就說，要你改改那不吭一聲地盯著人看的習慣了吧！
Korean:
………
…그러니까 말이야, 그 아무말 없이 쳐다보는 버릇
그만두라고 했잖앗!
German:
...
Mensch, habe ich es dir nicht schon mal gesagt?
Hör auf, so zu starren! Echt!

English:
I think with that, this case is closed now, so...
Thanks. I'm...going to stay here a little longer
and think, if that's all right with you.
Chinese:
這樣我的委託就結束了，那個……真的很謝謝你。
……我會多待在這裡一陣子。
Korean:
이걸로 의뢰 종료야. 그… 정말 고마워
…나는 조금 더 여기 있을래
German:
Ich denke, damit ist der Fall abgeschlossen.
Danke. Ich glaube, ich bleibe noch etwas hier
und denke nach, wenn das okay ist.
